item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Chip Kidd
item.description: "Just who are the cheese monkeys? And what do they want?" -- Chip Kidd

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was books that taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, or who had ever been alive." -- James Baldwin

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by James A. Baldwin
item.description: "Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up." -- James A. Baldwin

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain." -- James Baldwin

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Theophilus Crowe's mobile phone played eight bars of "Tangled Up in Blue" in an irritating electronic voice that sounded like a choir of suffering houseflies, or Jiminy Cricket huffing helium, or, well, you know, Bob Dylan." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "There are perhaps no days of our childhood we lived so fully as those we believe we left without having lived them, those we spent with a favorite book." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Without words, without writing and without books there would be no history, there could be no concept of humanity." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Whoever wants music instead of noise, joy instead of pleasure, soul instead of gold, creative work instead of business, passion instead of foolery, finds no home in this trivial world of ours." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Iris Murdoch
item.description: "Love is the extremely difficult realization that something other than oneself is real." -- Iris Murdoch

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Joyce Carol Oates
item.description: "I never change, I simply become more myself." -- Joyce Carol Oates

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Every heart sings a song, incomplete, until another heart whispers back. Those who wish to sing always find a song. At the touch of a lover, everyone becomes a poet." -- Plato

item.title: rytr_1 add a quote by David Gilmour
item.description: "...the second time you see something is really the <i>first</i> time. You need to know how it ends before you can appreciate how beautifully it's put together from the beginning." -- David Gilmour
